page.title: 14Traditional Highland Dancing
page.content: By holding 3 weekly classes in Towie Public Hall over 7 years,a dancer from Glenkindie trains on average 40 local children aged between 4 & 16 in Highland & National Dancing.A piper plays for the dancers at many displays The most popular event for dancers & pipers alike is the local Lonach Gathering in August each year. For the Highland Dances which originally were danced by men,the kilt,jacket,tartan socks & white blouse are worn. For National Dances,the Aboyne Dress of flared tartan skirt with petticoat topped by a matching waistcoat over a white blouse takes precedence.Highland dancing pumps,neatly laced,allow intricate steps to be performed.This activity has expanded in the area over the last fourteen years and promises to do so as all things traditional are being jealously nurtured.
